name: .XLW File Extension
summary: Learn about .XLW files and view a list of programs that open them.

description: An XLW file is a workspace file created by Microsoft Excel, a spreadsheets application. It contains the screen locations of one or more workbooks, as well as references to the workbook files. XLW files are used to restore the layout when working simultaneously on multiple workbooks.

content: Beginning with Excel 2013 and later versions, Excel no longer allows you to save workspaces as XLW files. However, the application still allows you to open XLW files saved with Excel 2010 and earlier.
To create an XLW workspace file with Excel 2007 or 2010, follow these steps:
Open the workbook(s) you want included in the workspace and arrange them to how you want them to appear
Click Save Workspace in the Window group in the View tab.
Name the file, choose the save location, and click Save
NOTE: XLW files do not include workbook data files. They only store the layout of the workbooks on the screen. You must have all workbook files available to reopen an XLW file properly.

instructions: You can only open XLW files with Microsoft Excel in Windows and macOS. To open an XLW file, select File â†’ Open, choose the file, and click Open.
When XLW files are opened, Excel restores the workbooks back to their saved locations on the screen.
